replies.msg:
908支持《香港人權及民主法案》嘅行動已經係甚囂塵上，但如果冇不反對通知書，可能好多和理非都唔敢去但明知犬方唔會批，我哋又冇理由繼續向佢哋申請

既然係咁，我地就反其道而行，通知美領嗰邊話我哋會去集會遊行，交下請願信之類，問佢哋反唔反對。只要佢哋無講明反對（佢哋無可能會反對），變相就係我哋已經得到美領方面嘅不反對通知書

到時如果犬方又發癲，講錯一句嘢都會陷入外交風波班狗夠膽就喺美領度射催淚彈，到時一唔小心射咗入去，列根號嚟香港嘅日子還會遠嗎？

replies.msg:
唔係英文/translate/journal出身 請見諒
=================
Dear Sir/Madam,

Recently, there was a pro-democracy protest occurred in Hong Kong, however, it was brutally oppressed by the Hong Kong Government and the Chinese Communist Party behind.

Hong Kong citizens knew that the "Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act" is about to be passed in the US Congress, and we are sincerely glad that US would sanction the Chinese officials who violated the human rights of Hong Kong people, including not keeping the promise of having free election of the Chief Executive of Hong Kong, allowing police violence and recruiting gangsters to attack the protesters and even innocent citizens. Those crimes should be condemned internationally, and the Hong Kong and Chinese officials should bear the responsibilities.

Some of the Hong Kong citizens are planning to have an assembly in front of the US Consulate in 8th September (Sunday) afternoon, to show their support to this bill. I am not the organizer of the activity but as far as I know, the assembly would be definitely peaceful, including bringing roses to the consulate, also singing US national anthem and waving US national flag.

Hong Kong citizens would like to inform our honorable and dearest friend, the US about our upcoming assembly. Hope that the US Consulate General of Hong Kong and Macau would show their support to Hong Kong people who sided with the Americans to fight for democracy and freedom, and the assembly could be peacefully demonstrated.

Best Regards,
XXX
A Hong Kong Citizen
